rand-althor.name: Rand al'Thor
aliases: He Who Comes With the Dawn

1.description: Rules from the Stone of Tear as the Dragon Reborn. Struggles with leadership and the weight of prophecy.

24.description: Enters the twisted doorway ter'angreal in Rhuidean, experiencing visions of Aiel history and his own lineage.

26.description: Learns he is of Aiel blood, descendant of Aiel who served the Aes Sedai in the Age of Legends.

57.description: Recognized as Car'a'carn by the Aiel, the prophesied chief of chiefs who will unite all clans.

1.description: Reluctantly stays in the Stone of Tear. His ancient memories make him an exceptional battle commander.

24.description: Enters the twisted doorway in Rhuidean, gaining gifts and knowledge from the Aelfinn and Eelfinn.

29.description: Returns to the Two Rivers to find it under attack by Trollocs and Whitecloaks. Becomes a reluctant leader.

40.description: Accepts leadership role in defending the Two Rivers. His wolf abilities become more pronounced.

29.description: Accompanies Perrin to the Two Rivers. Her noble upbringing helps in organizing the defense.

11.description: Training with the Wise Ones in the Waste. Learning Aiel customs and developing her abilities.

20.description: Develops strong friendships with Aviendha and learns about Aiel culture and ji'e'toh.

11.description: Travels to Tanchico with Elayne to hunt Black Ajah and search for ter'angreal.
Partners with Nynaeve in hunting Black Ajah in Tanchico. Her royal training proves valuable.

1.description: Assigned by Wise Ones to guard and teach Rand about Aiel ways. Hostile but bound by duty.

20.description: Develops friendship with Egwene. Reveals she can channel but was trained as a Maiden instead.

1.description: Clan chief supporting Rand as He Who Comes With the Dawn. Wise and experienced leader.

11.description: Wise One of the Taardad Aiel, one of Rhuarc's wives. Powerful dreamwalker and teacher.
Ancient Wise One who cannot channel but is a powerful dreamwalker. Very wise and respected.
Young Wise One with fiery red hair and temper. Can channel and dreamwalk.
Wise One who helps train Egwene in Aiel customs and the use of the One Power.
Clan chief of the Tomanelle Aiel. One of the chiefs following He Who Comes With the Dawn.

relationships.Allegiance: He Who Comes With the Dawn

11.description: Clan chief of the Shaarad Aiel. Another supporter of the Dragon Reborn's claim.
Clan chief of the Chareen Aiel. Follows the prophesied Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Nakai Aiel. Respected leader among the Aiel clans.
Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel. One of the chiefs accepting Rand's leadership.
Shaido clan warrior who opposes Rand's claim as He Who Comes With the Dawn. Arrogant and ambitious.

28.description: Claims the title of Car'a'carn for himself using fake dragon marks. Leads the Shaido in rebellion.

22.description: Shaido warrior who enters Rhuidean alongside Rand. Couladin's brother and rival claimant.

26.description: Dies in Rhuidean, unable to complete the test that reveals Aiel history and purpose.

29.description: Accompanies Perrin to the Two Rivers. His Aiel warrior skills prove invaluable in the defense.
Maiden warrior helping defend the Two Rivers. Her spear skills are unmatched.
Maiden warrior from a different clan than Bain, but bound as first-sisters. Expert fighter.
Helps organize the Two Rivers defense. His military experience proves crucial in training farmers.
Mat's father, helps lead the Two Rivers defense. Skilled with a bow and experienced fighter.
Perrin's father, a blacksmith who helps arm the Two Rivers defenders. Proud of his son's leadership.
Village blacksmith who works tirelessly to arm the Two Rivers defenders. Former master to Perrin.
Master Luhhan's wife, helps organize the women's efforts in the Two Rivers defense.
Mayor of Emond's Field, works with Perrin to coordinate the village's defense efforts.
Egwene's mother and innkeeper, provides shelter and support during the Two Rivers crisis.
Leader of the Women's Circle, helps organize the civilian defense and support efforts.
Young man from the Two Rivers who joins the defense. Becomes one of Perrin's trusted fighters.
Two Rivers man who helps in the defense. Father to Tell and Dannil.
Young fighter in the Two Rivers defense. Son of Ban Crawe.
Two Rivers defender, brother to Tell. Becomes one of Perrin's reliable fighters.

33.description: Appears in the Two Rivers calling himself Ordeith. Manipulates the Whitecloaks into attacking.
Lord Captain of the Whitecloaks attacking the Two Rivers. Seeks vengeance for his father's death.
Fanatical Whitecloak who serves under Dain Bornhald. Convinced Perrin is a Darkfriend.

1.description: Continues to guide Rand while dealing with the complexities of ruling from the Stone of Tear.
Serves as Rand's sword instructor and bodyguard while bound to Moiraine as her Warder.

11.description: Accompanies Nynaeve and Elayne to Tanchico. His knowledge of politics and the Game of Houses proves invaluable.

1.description: Tairen High Lord serving under Rand. Vain and ambitious, but competent in his own way.
High Lord of Tear who must adapt to serving under the Dragon Reborn's rule.

11.description: Thief-catcher who aids Nynaeve and Elayne in Tanchico. His skills prove essential in navigating the city.

25.description: One of the Forsaken, master of Tel'aran'rhiod. Operates from shadows and prefers subtle manipulation.

54.description: One of the Forsaken, captured by Rand and forced to teach him to channel. Former Age of Legends musician.

relationships.Past: Musician of the Age of Legends

25.description: One of the Forsaken who has taken control of Andor by manipulating Queen Morgase through Compulsion.
Queen of Andor, under the influence of Rahvin's Compulsion. Her will has been subverted by the Forsaken.

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Loial son of Arent son of Halan

29.description: Travels with Perrin to the Two Rivers. His Ogier strength and loyalty make him invaluable in defense.

11.description: Clan chief of the Goshien Aiel. Tall and powerful, with two wives who are both Wise Ones.
Wise One and first-wife to Bael. Gray-haired and dignified, with strong presence among the Aiel.
Clan chief of the Daryne Aiel. One of the chiefs supporting the Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Daryne Aiel, working alongside other chiefs to support the prophecies.
Clan chief of the Codarra Aiel. Strong supporter of the Car'a'carn prophecies.
Clan chief of the Miagoma Aiel. Respected among the chiefs for his wisdom.
Clan chief of the Jhirad Aiel. Another of the chiefs following the prophecied Car'a'carn.
Clan chief supporting the gathering of Aiel around He Who Comes With the Dawn.
Ancient Wise One with white hair, incredibly strong-willed and respected among all Aiel. Cannot channel but has great authority.
Wise One who helps instruct the apprentices in Aiel law and tradition.
Wise One known for her skill in interpreting dreams and visions.
Rhuarc's first-wife, a Wise One with golden hair. Mother of several children and respected for her wisdom.
One of Rhuarc's children, represents the next generation of Aiel growing up during prophecy.

1.description: White-haired Maiden of the Spear, one of the leaders among the Far Dareis Mai. Fierce and protective.
Red-haired Maiden of the Spear, one of those guarding the Dragon Reborn in the Stone.
Green-eyed Maiden warrior serving among the Car'a'carn's guard in Tear.
Maiden of the Spear assigned to watch over the Dragon Reborn's activities.
Yellow-haired Maiden known for her quick wit and fierce loyalty to Aiel honor.

29.description: Mat's mother, worried about her son but proud of his reputation. Helps organize the women's defense efforts.
Mat's younger sister, caught between childhood and the harsh realities of the Trolloc attacks.
Mat's sister, one of the young women showing potential ability to channel.
Perrin's mother, overjoyed at her son's return but worried about his golden eyes and strange abilities.
Perrin's uncle, a solid Two Rivers man who supports the defense efforts.
Perrin's aunt, helps care for refugees and wounded during the Trolloc attacks.
Troublesome Two Rivers man, part of the Coplin family known for complaints and stirring up problems.
Another of the Coplin family, reluctantly participates in village defense despite his complaints.
Member of the Congar family, known for being as troublesome as the Coplins but helps defend the village when needed.
Young man from Emond's Field eager to prove himself in the defense. Shows courage beyond his years.
Farmer and part-time miller who becomes one of the more reliable fighters in the Two Rivers defense.
Village farrier who uses his horseshoeing skills to help with weapons and defense preparations.

12.description: Panarch of Tarabon, the ceremonial ruler balancing the power of the King. Beautiful but caught in political turmoil.
King of Tarabon, sharing power with the Panarch in the traditional Taraboner system of dual rule.
Former Red Ajah sister, now revealed as Black Ajah. One of the most dangerous members in Tanchico.
White Ajah sister who joined the Black Ajah. Searches for powerful ter'angreal in Tanchico.
Green Ajah sister who turned to the Black Ajah. Works with other Black sisters in Tanchico.
Wise Woman in Tanchico with knowledge of herbs and healing. Connected to various political factions.

1.description: Cairhienin merchant leading a peddler's caravan. Pale and calculating, with hidden agendas.
Darkfriend and gleeman traveling with Kadere's caravan. Beautiful but dangerous.
Heavy-set woman traveling with Kadere's caravan. Actually Lanfear in disguise.

29.description: Mahdi (leader) of a Tinker band. Peaceful and wise, follows the Way of the Leaf despite surrounding violence.
Raen's wife, a Tinker woman who embodies the peaceful way of her people despite the violence around them.
Young Tinker man struggling with the Way of the Leaf as violence threatens his people.

26.description: Da'shain Aiel ancestor seen in Rand's visions through the glass columns. Served the Aes Sedai in the Age of Legends.
Da'shain Aiel ancestor, son of Jonai, seen leading his people in the visions of Aiel history.
Da'shain Aiel ancestor who broke the Way of the Leaf, becoming the first to take up weapons and split from the Da'shain.
Da'shain Aiel ancestor, one of those who maintained the Way of the Leaf even as others abandoned it.
Nym from the Age of Legends, seen in the historical visions as one of the beings the Da'shain Aiel served.

relationships.Nature: Living construct of the One Power

1.description: High Lord of Tear serving under the Dragon Reborn's rule. Adapts to the new order while maintaining his position.
High Lord of Tear who must navigate serving the Dragon Reborn while protecting his own interests.
High Lord of Tear known for his ambition and careful political maneuvering under the new regime.

33.description: Child of the Light serving under Dain Bornhald in the Two Rivers campaign.
Whitecloak soldier participating in the Two Rivers occupation under Bornhald's command.

29.description: Young woman from the Two Rivers, one of those showing signs of being able to learn channeling.
Mat's youngest sister, showing early signs of channeling ability during the crisis.
Two Rivers woman who demonstrates channeling ability and helps in the defense efforts.

12.description: Taraboner woman in Tanchico who provides lodging and information to Nynaeve and Elayne.
Former ship's crew member now working as a thug and spy in Tanchico's underworld.
Seanchan officer involved in operations around Tanchico, part of the remnant forces.
Seanchan ship captain hunting for marath'damane (women who can channel) in Tanchico waters.
Seanchan sul'dam (damane handler) operating in Tanchico area, loyal to the Empire.
Seanchan sul'dam working with damane in the Tanchico region.
Seanchan sul'dam involved in operations around Tanchico.

1.description: Tairen servant working in the Stone, adjusting to the new reality under Aiel occupation.
Kitchen worker in the Stone of Tear, gossiping about the strange events and Aiel.
Tear city guard dealing with the changed dynamics of the city under the Dragon Reborn.

29.description: Two Rivers woman helping care for wounded and refugees during the Trolloc attacks.
Young Two Rivers man eager to prove himself in the defense against Shadowspawn.
Two Rivers farmer turned fighter, learning to use weapons to defend his home.
Two Rivers shepherd who becomes part of the village defense force.

11.description: Thunder Walker society warrior among the Aiel, known for his speed and stealth.
Red Shield warrior society member, known for defensive tactics and clan protection.
Night Spear society member among the Aiel, specializing in night raids and stealth attacks.
Black Eye warrior society member, known for relentless pursuit of enemies.
Water Seeker society member, responsible for finding and protecting water sources.
True Blood society member, part of the elite Aiel warrior society.

29.description: Two Rivers miller's son who joins the defense against Trollocs and Whitecloaks.
Two Rivers farmer who becomes skilled with the bow during the Trolloc Wars.
Young Two Rivers man learning swordwork from Lan's teaching methods passed down.
Mayor of Watch Hill, coordinates with other Two Rivers communities for mutual defense.
Mayor of Deven Ride, works with other Two Rivers leaders during the crisis.
Taren Ferry leader dealing with refugees and the collapse of normal river trade.
Refugee woman from outlying farms, lost her home to Trolloc raids.
Refugee farmer who escaped Trolloc attacks with his family, seeking safety in the villages.

11.description: Wise One apprentice learning the ways of prophecy and healing among the Aiel.
Young woman training to become a Wise One, studying under the experienced teachers.

1.description: Aiel warrior serving in the Stone of Tear, adapting to wetlander ways while maintaining Aiel honor.
Aiel spear-brother serving among the Car'a'carn's guards, loyal and fierce.
Young Aiel warrior eager to prove himself in service to He Who Comes With the Dawn.

relationships.Service: He Who Comes With the Dawn

31.description: Trolloc leader commanding raids against Two Rivers villages.
Myrddraal directing Trolloc attacks on the Two Rivers.

12.description: Sea Folk Sailmistress commanding a ship near Tanchico waters.
Sea Folk Windfinder with weather-working abilities.
Sea Folk crew member serving on vessels near Tarabon.
Sea Folk navigator working the Tanchico shipping lanes.
Sea Folk trader conducting business in Tanchico port.
Illuminator fleeing from the Guild's destruction.
Illianer ship captain operating in Tanchico waters.

33.description: Child of the Light serving under Dain Bornhald.
Fanatical Whitecloak believing in Ordeith's lies.
Whitecloak questioning the Two Rivers mission.

1.description: Maiden of the Spear guarding the Car'a'carn.
Skilled Maiden warrior with exceptional spear work.
Red-haired Maiden known for her quick temper.
Maiden specializing in night watches and security.
Young Maiden eager to prove herself worthy.

29.description: Two Rivers woman showing channeling potential.
Village girl helping care for refugees.
Farmer turned archer defending his home.
Young shepherd learning to fight.
Miller's son joining the village defense.

1.description: Minor Tairen lord serving in the Stone.
High Lord dealing with Dragon Reborn's rule.
Tairen lord adapting to Aiel presence.
Lord managing Stone logistics under new regime.
Scholarly lord interested in prophecies.

29.description: Tinker craftsman in Raen's band.
Young Tinker musician and storyteller.
Tinker wagon driver and horse tender.
Tinker woman skilled in weaving and cloth work.
Elder Tinker providing wisdom to the band.

26.description: Nym from Age of Legends seen in Aiel visions.
Aes Sedai who helped create Callandor.
Aes Sedai involved in Rhuidean's construction.
Da'shain Aiel tasked with preserving Avendesora.
First Aiel to become a clan chief after breaking the Way.

1.description: Peddler in Kadere's caravan with hidden agendas.
Guard in the merchant caravan traveling to the Waste.
Driver handling wagons in Kadere's group.
Merchant assistant handling trade goods.
Scout and outrider for the caravan.

12.description: Darkfriend operating in Tanchico for the Shadow.
Whitecloak Questioner serving the Shadow secretly.

1.description: Darkfriend merchant with unknown agenda.

11.description: Wise One specializing in battle healing.
Wise One with strong earth-sense abilities.
Young Wise One learning advanced dreamwalking.
Wise One expert in birthing and children's care.
Stern Wise One enforcing proper behavior.

1.description: Stone servant adapting to Aiel presence.
Kitchen worker gossiping about changes.
Serving woman attending to noble quarters.
Stable hand caring for horses in the Stone.
Guard assigned to Stone security.

29.description: Village woman learning healing from Wisdom traditions.
Women's Circle member organizing refugee care.
Village seamstress helping with clothing and bandages.
Elder woman coordinating food distribution.
Young mother protecting children during attacks.
Village Council member supporting defense efforts.
Council member coordinating with other villages.
Council elder providing strategic advice.
Young man becoming skilled archer.
Experienced hunter leading patrols.
Farmer whose farm was burned by Trollocs.
Woman who lost family to Shadowspawn.
Young mother with children seeking shelter.

11.description: Stone Dog warrior known for stubbornness.
Thunder Walker specializing in rapid strikes.
Night Spear expert in stealth warfare.
Red Shield focused on defensive tactics.
Water Seeker with exceptional desert skills.

1.description: Defender of the Stone adapting to Aiel.

31.description: Trolloc leading attack fist against villages.

11.description: Aiel sept member following clan traditions.
Shaido sept member supporting Couladin.
Taardad sept member loyal to Rhuarc.
Goshien sept member under Bael.
Reyn sept member following Dhearic.

31.description: Trolloc band raiding Two Rivers farms.

29.description: Tinker child learning the Way of the Leaf.
Village woman learning healing from Daise.

12.description: Sea Folk sailor handling cargo near Tanchico.
Former Illuminator apprentice fleeing Guild destruction.

1.description: Tairen merchant adapting to Aiel customs.
Head cook managing Stone kitchens.

26.description: Dark presence in prophetic dreams.
Ancient guardian of Portal Stone knowledge.
Guardian of the Ways seen in ancient visions.
Ancient Ogier Elder from Age of Legends visions.
Nym working with Da'shain Aiel in visions.
Age of Legends scientist creating living constructs.
Da'shain Aiel master of the seed singing.
Keeper of the great Chora trees in Age of Legends.
Male channeler from the Breaking in visions.
First queen establishing post-Breaking kingdom.
Da'shain Aiel maintaining covenant with Aes Sedai.
Last Da'shain Aiel maintaining the Way of the Leaf.

recaps.1: Rand rules uncomfortably from the Stone of Tear while Aiel gather in the city, causing tension with the Tairen nobility.
recaps.2: Political tensions rise in Tear as the High Lords struggle to accept Aiel presence and Rand's authority.
recaps.3: Bubbles of evil continue to manifest around Rand, showing the Dark One's growing influence on the Pattern.
recaps.4: Rand struggles with dreams of the past and visions of possible futures as his power and responsibilities grow.
recaps.5: The Aiel begin sharing their customs and beliefs with Rand, though many mysteries remain about their culture.
recaps.6: Moiraine attempts to guide Rand politically while the Stone becomes a center of prophecy and power.
recaps.7: Various factions position themselves around the Dragon Reborn as news of his identity spreads across nations.
recaps.8: Rand's relationship with the Aiel deepens as he learns more about their honor code and warrior traditions.
recaps.9: Political machinations intensify as various rulers and powers react to the Dragon Reborn's emergence.
recaps.10: The Aiel reveal more of their prophecies about He Who Comes With the Dawn, matching their beliefs to Rand.
recaps.11: Egwene travels to the Aiel Waste with the Wise Ones to learn about Aiel culture and her own growing abilities.
recaps.12: Nynaeve and Elayne journey to Tanchico following leads about Black Ajah and dangerous ter'angreal.
recaps.13: The hunt for Black Ajah intensifies as the sisters discover plots involving powerful artifacts and prophecies.
recaps.14: In Tanchico, political chaos erupts as various factions fight for control of the declining Panarch's empire.
recaps.15: Egwene's training with the Wise Ones reveals the depth of Aiel wisdom and their connection to dreams.
recaps.16: The search in Tanchico becomes dangerous as Black Ajah members work to retrieve powerful ter'angreal.
recaps.17: Rand prepares to travel to Rhuidean in the Aiel Waste to learn the truth about Aiel history and prophecy.
recaps.18: Political tensions continue to build as the Dragon Reborn's actions affect kingdoms across the continent.
recaps.19: The journey to the Aiel Waste begins, with various groups traveling toward their separate destinations.
recaps.20: Egwene and Aviendha develop their friendship while learning about each other's cultures and abilities.
recaps.21: In Tanchico, the investigation into Black Ajah activities reveals a web of conspiracy and dangerous plots.
recaps.22: Rand and Mat arrive in Rhuidean, the forbidden city where only clan chiefs and Wise Ones may enter safely.
recaps.23: The ancient city of Rhuidean holds mysteries and tests that will determine the fate of those who enter.
recaps.24: Mat and Rand enter ter'angreal that show different aspects of history and possible futures.
recaps.25: Moghedien, the Spider, begins weaving her web of plans involving the World of Dreams and ancient artifacts.
recaps.26: Rand experiences visions of Aiel history through his ancestors' eyes, learning their true origins and purpose.
recaps.27: The visions reveal the Aiel's past as the Da'shain Aiel, peaceful servants of Aes Sedai in the Age of Legends.
recaps.28: Couladin emerges from Rhuidean claiming to be the Car'a'carn, though his marks are false.
recaps.29: Perrin returns to the Two Rivers to find his homeland under attack by Trollocs and occupied by Whitecloaks.
recaps.30: The Two Rivers faces a crisis as Shadowspawn attack while Children of the Light claim to protect the region.
recaps.31: Perrin must overcome his reluctance to lead in order to organize an effective defense of his people.
recaps.32: The defense of Emond's Field begins as farmers and craftsmen are trained to fight Shadowspawn.
recaps.33: Padan Fain appears as 'Ordeith,' manipulating the Whitecloaks into attacking the very people they claim to protect.
recaps.34: Battles rage across the Two Rivers as multiple threats converge on the peaceful farming communities.
recaps.35: The Two Rivers folk show unexpected courage and determination in defending their homes against overwhelming odds.
recaps.36: Perrin's leadership grows stronger as he accepts responsibility for protecting his people and homeland.
recaps.37: The siege of Emond's Field intensifies as Trollocs mass for a final assault on the village defenses.
recaps.38: Desperate measures are taken to hold the defenses as the enemy forces seem overwhelming.
recaps.39: Hope arrives as unexpected allies appear to aid in the defense of the Two Rivers communities.
recaps.40: The tide of battle begins to turn as the Two Rivers defenders find new strength and tactical advantages.
recaps.41: Victory in the Two Rivers comes at a cost, but the homeland is saved from Shadow and Whitecloak occupation.
recaps.42: The aftermath of the battles reveals changes in both the land and the people who defended it.
recaps.43: Political ramifications of the Two Rivers conflicts spread as news reaches other kingdoms and rulers.
recaps.44: The Two Rivers begins to recover and rebuild, forever changed by the trials of war and leadership.
recaps.45: Perrin's reputation as a leader spreads beyond the Two Rivers, attracting both allies and enemies.
recaps.46: The consequences of the battles affect relationships and power structures throughout the region.
recaps.47: New alliances form as the success of the Two Rivers defense inspires others facing similar threats.
recaps.48: The changing political landscape reflects the broader transformation occurring across the continent.
recaps.49: Preparations begin for future challenges as the Two Rivers establishes its new place in the world.
recaps.50: The defense's success becomes a symbol of resistance against both Shadow and oppression.
recaps.51: Stories of the Two Rivers battles spread, inspiring hope and fear in equal measure among different factions.
recaps.52: The transformed Two Rivers begins to play a larger role in continental politics and prophecy.
recaps.53: New responsibilities and relationships emerge from the crucible of battle and leadership.
recaps.54: Asmodean is captured by Rand and forced to become his teacher in the use of saidin and the One Power.
recaps.55: The consequences of having a Forsaken as an unwilling teacher create new dangers and opportunities.
recaps.56: Political and personal relationships shift as the various storylines begin to converge toward future conflicts.
recaps.57: Rand is acknowledged as Car'a'carn by the Aiel clans, though the Shaido under Couladin remain in rebellion.
recaps.58: The stage is set for greater conflicts as the Dragon Reborn's growing power attracts both followers and enemies.
